benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/admin/cache - Invalidates the given Cache if specified, otherwise invalidates all caches

covered: Valid Deletion paths tested (TC01, TC02, TC13, TC14) with 204 responses and empty bodies.
Error handling for non-existent caches (TC03) with 400 and appropriate message.
Cache state constraints covered (TC04) for not-alive caches.
Input validation coverage for cacheName (TC05, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC15) with various invalid inputs.
Authorization handling covered (TC06) with 401/403 and messages.
Server error handling covered (TC07) with 500 and server messages.
No caches exist scenario (TC08) with 204 and empty body.
Query parameter handling including extra parameters (TC09) and various param combinations.
Performance and concurrency aspects covered (TC13, TC14) including large datasets and concurrent requests.
Response body expectations (204 with empty body) achieved across successful deletions.
Case-sensitivity and regression scenarios covered (TC12, TC15).
gaps: Rate limiting / throttling tests for DELETE to verify handling of bursts of requests.
Caching semantics tests (ETag, Cache-Control headers) in DELETE responses.
Observability / metrics / logging validation to ensure cache invalidation events are recorded.
Extended concurrency scenarios for race conditions across different caches and partial invalidations.
recommendations: Add tests for rate limiting and throttling on DELETE /1.0/kb/admin/cache.
Add tests to verify caching headers are returned (ETag/Cache-Control) and correct caching behavior.
Add observability tests to confirm invalidations are emitted to logs/metrics.
Add more concurrency tests with mixed cache states and ensure no race conditions when multiple clients invalidate caches simultaneously.
